name: Backoff
title: Gcloud
Backoff
description: Backoff allows users to control how Google API calls are retried. If an API call fails the response will be checked to see if the call can be retried. If the response matches the criteria, then it will be retried with an incremental backoff. This means that an increasing delay will be added between each retried call. The first retry will be delayed one second, the second retry will be delayed two seconds, and so on.

examples.code:
require "gcloud/backoff"

Gcloud::Backoff.retries = 5 # Set a maximum of five retries per call

Backoff.retries
methods.description:
The number of times a retriable API call should be retried.

The default value is 3.

methods.name: backoff
title: Gcloud
Backoff.backoff
methods.description:
The code to run when a backoff is handled. This must be a Proc and must take the number of retries as an argument.

Note: This method is undocumented and may change.
